cause.description:
We help support people struggling with bipolar disorder and their families. The criticism should stop toward people with mental disorders. This group is for people to get together and talk about their thoughts on having bipolar or for families to discuss what it's like having a loved one with bipolar. Most of the "bad talk" about bipolar disorder comes from the unknown. People just aren't aware of what bipolar is. Merriam-Webster's Medical Dictionary defines bipolar disorder as: any of several mood disorders characterized usually by alternating episodes of depression and mania or by episodes of depression alternating with mild nonpsychotic excitement.
1. Bipolar disorder can be a difficult disease at times.
2. Having bipolar DOES NOT mean you are different from anyone else.
cause.mission: Help support children, adolescents, and adults struggling with the every day issues that come with having Bipolar Disorder.
cause.name: Bipolar Disorder Support and Awareness
